ratings.comment: when Dr Malloy was our phys Ed substitute he rode his Segway into the room and hit his head on the doorframe and made us run laps the whole class
Dr Malloy has a jar of all his baby teeth on his desk
Dr Malloy passed a kidney stone in class
In a freak lawnmowing accident dr malloy severed his left thumb toe so he has been a bit hysterical lately
Dr. malloy has been accused of spreading communist propaganda in canada
Dr Malloy is associated with Osama Bin Laden and the terrorist attacks on 9/11
Dr malloy has JFK's kidneys in his fridge
He is great
He's amazing
He's great
Great guy. Very cool.

A great teacher that prepared me for high school very well. His class was difficult but not frustrating. He explains things good. He gets game. He is super chill. The only way you wouldn't like him is if you suck at math.
He is so bad of a teacher I would never like to see him again
he is good

I should probably preface this by saying I hate math. However, for such a low/elementary level class this course was ridiculously challenging. Can't mathway your grade into an A. Do the work, go to the tutoring sessions. Overall Malloy attempts to help students, but lectures are terribly dull.

Jake honestly was a terrible professor. He does not explain things well at all. Weekly homework & online quizzes (like 5 questions tho) are super easy, but the tests are ridiculous. He honestly does not know how to teach. Usually attendance is a mandatory part of ur grade. He makes you do worksheets in class & honestly just sucks. I barely passed

Great professor, was shy at first but knew how to explain things so that they were easier to understand. Good practice problems in class and the homework/tests reflected what he taught in lecture. Always tried to make class fun by integrating little games and the like.

Really nice professor and lectures are neatly organized. Walked the class through most examples though so it was harder to do problems on your own at first. Homework is assigned weekly online, also no calculator on exams

If you do not have a good understanding of algebra coming into this class, you will not do well. The only was I earned and AB was due to do fact that I remembered most from high school. The way Jake&TAs explains concepts is just confusing and not helpful. On many occasions I had to email by high school algebra teacher for something to make sense.

Jake Malloy is not a good teacher. Im sure he's a nice guy but he's rude in class, does not teach the material well, and makes everything much harder than it needs to be. He makes you more confused during class and the homework is way easier than the test. I would not take this class because he does not know how to explain the concepts.

Not a good professor in my opinion, not very accessible outside of class having only 2 days where he attends lab hours for 1 hour. Gives sample problems in class but rarely goes over the answers. doesn't explain things well. came into class understanding some concepts then with how he explains it im so lost and confused, most help comes from the TA

I think if you actually do all of the homework without a calculator, show up to lectures and pay attention you'll do fine. I barely paid attention, skipped a few lectures on non-group quiz days and prepared a minimal amount but still managed to make it out with a C lol but it was pretty tough. The videos on his youtube channel are super helpful.

The whole class was SO disappointing. I have never had a math teacher who was completely incompetent of teaching material effectively. The lectures were purely his stream of consciousness in 3 word spurts that often led to no clear answer (as he rarely finishes a problem). You leave class feeling unprepared for tests and bored. DON'T recommend.

He rarely finishes a sample problem completely through and struggles to communicate his knowledge to the class, if he has any I am not sure. He told us he struggles with arithmatic and we should stop if he makes a mistake which seems hilarious since he is teaching algebra. You might as well just teach yourself all the material as he is no help
Lectures are boring and awkward, tests and homework are much harder than what's presented in class
SO BAD. Doesn't know how to teach at all but if you teach yourself the material and read the textbook you should be fine. Overall its just OK.
actually the worst. he plays with graphs the entire time and is an ass. there are no curves to the tests
Not specific in lectures, doesn't really know how to teach or deal with students, very condescending, homework and tests are always much more difficult than what he teaches in class
